poem:
"Lines Changed, Tracks Unseen"

Confusion dances on metal,
like clouds on skies of Government minds.
A cancelled wing, HS2,
A tale of steel woven, then undone.
Pockets echo with absent coins,
Tracks laid for phantom trains,
Destination: uncertainty.
Yet we move, chest-heaving forward,
A dance in dark tunnels,
The silence of the northern leg,
A song unheard.
Can you listen, Rishi?
Do you hear the ghostly echo,
Promises, tracks unseen?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Government ‘does not understand how HS2 will function as railway’ The cancellation of the northern leg of HS2 has raised “urgent unanswered questions” and the government does not yet understand how the £67bn high-speed railway will now function, according to a scathing report from parliament’s spending watchdog. The remaining London-Birmingham line will be “very poor value for money”, the public accounts committee of MPs said, with costs now forecast to significantly outweigh the benefits. Rishi". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Government ‘does not understand how HS2 will function as railway’ The cancellation of the northern leg of HS2 has raised “urgent unanswered questions” and the government does not yet understand how the £67bn high-speed railway will now function, according to a scathing report from parliament’s spending watchdog. The remaining London-Birmingham line will be “very poor value for money”, the public accounts committee of MPs said, with costs now forecast to significantly outweigh the benefits. Rishi
